Shares of several oil & gas companies are trading lower after EIA crude inventories for January 3rd showed a 1.164 million barrel build vs a 3.572 million barrel draw estimate. Companies continued to trade lower after President Trump gave a press conference which eased investors concern over escalation in the Middle East.
Shares of oil companies are trading lower, cooling down from the recent rally as traders' concerns of Middle East tensions ease.

Shares of several oil and gas companies are trading higher on continued momentum after the U.S. confirmed an airstrike that killed a top Iranian commander. The death of Soleimani raised geopolitical concerns in the Middle East, causing oil prices to rise.
